Een online meeting (tenzij anders vermeld) voor iedereen die geÃ¯nteresseerd is om een steentje bij te dragen aan het 'Media & Communicatie' (M&C) team. 

Stuur ons een berichtje voor de meeting-link of als je geÃ¯nteresseerd bent om mee te helpen met onze activiteiten.

Wat regelt het M&C team allemaal?
- Wij beheren de sociale media pagina's van XR Rotterdam (Facebook, Instagram en Twitter). Ook het beantwoorden van DM's bijvoorbeeld valt hier onder.
- Een deel van de teamleden schrijft persberichten als nodig.
- Ook zijn wij verantwoordelijk voor het vinden van fotografen of filmers, en we houden contact met hen.

An online meeting (unless stated otherwise) for anyone interested in contributing to the 'Media & Communication' (M&C) team.

Send us a message for the meeting-link or if you are interested in helping out with our activities in general.

What does the M&C team do?
- We manage the social media pages of XR Rotterdam (Facebook, Instagram and Twitter). This also includes answering DM's.
- Some of the team members write press releases when needed.
- We are also responsible for finding photographers of videographers, and we keep in touch with them.
- Communication with other teams within XR Rotterdam and also with the media team of XRNL.

group_name: Extinction RÃ©bellion Val de Seine - Events
title: Ne soldons pas nos vies !

description:
Join us for this month's People's Assembly

New Year, New Rebels!
One of the biggest parts of growing our movement and increasing our impact is the welcoming of new rebels. On Wed 20 Jan we'll be chatting about:
  * What was your experience as a brand new rebel?
  * How do you welcome new rebels into your group?
  * How can we empower more rebels to pick up roles?

Come join us and share your experiences with your fellow rebels!

Sign up for the PA here: https://actionnetwork.org/events/assembly-new-year-new-rebels/

Everything discussed will be fed to the Communities and Rebel Pathways teams so that we can share the best ideas across the movement and try to support the needs which arise.

This session is part of a monthly program of assemblies run by the Communities Team to feed your needs into the work we do for you. We want to hear of successes and challenges you face in your local areas so that we can help each other!

UK Communities Assemblies - 3rd Wednesday of every month

group_name: Morecambe Bay Extinction Rebels public group
title: XR UK Communities People's Assembly

description:
Our regular monthly open meeting but we are being a bit different for a dark January night.   Bring a drink, your supper, a mug of tea . . . we will be having a relaxed sharing of stories about events and actions we've been involved in over the years.  XR and way before XR.  We will also focus on dreaming up ideas for actions in the year ahead. 

We did a similar activity in December which worked well.  This is about connecting and inspiring each other. 
It will be followed up in February with some more detailed planning for the year ahead.
 Zoom link . . . . 
 https://us02web.zoom.us/j/81310965442 
 Everyone is very welcome - for anyone new to XR - this is  a friendly way to meet others, for folks engaged already - a way to build our community and get to know one another better.  We are all crew . . none of us are professional storytellers yet we all have stories to tell . . . of HS2; of Preston New Rd, of polar bears and coal pits, of lying down in Market Square, of dancing discobedience on Morecambe Prom, of boats in the middle of London, of Greehnam  . . . of wild red rebels up on Clougha . . . . All very relaxed and informal - come and tell us all what actions inspired, scared, infuriated, changed you . . . .

description:
Non-violent direct action (NVDA) is fundamental to Extinction Rebellion's theory of change and has been critical to bringing about the political recognition the climate and ecological crisis has received over the past few years in the UK and around the world.

The training will provide an overview of NVDA and is open to all, whether you are already a part of Extinction Rebellion or would like to join the movement.

This training is 3 hours long (including breaks) and will explore:
- What NVDA is and how it can be used.
- What COVID means for direct action
- What an affinity group is and why it is important for NVDA
- Practical techniques in Body Blockading
- De-escalation practice for interaction with members of the public
- Legal briefing

Join here:

Topic: NVDA Training 
Time: Jan 23, 2021 05:00 PM London

We will ringing in the new year by proclaiming our 2021 Climate Resolutions!

We are also going to take time to address the attempted coup that took place on January 6tth.  This is the antithesis of what Extinction Rebellion stands for. We watched large groups of insurrectionist promoting white supremacy, anti-Semitism, and ultra-nationalist ideologies in a violent way. In this community meeting, we would like to reinforce our commitment to a Just Transition that includes all people, and prioritize the need for a peopleâ€™s democracy (Citizen's Assemblies) and the principles behind our Non-Violent Direct Action.

description:
- 2020 tied with 2016 as the worldâ€™s hottest year
- Itâ€™s 2021 and our politicians continue to invest in projects that harm our future
- 2021 is an election year, we need to be back in rebellion stronger than ever before
- We need you to help us grow the movement to have the impact we need

Join this workshop to explore how we can promote our talks, meetings, and actions online during the pandemic to bring back inactive rebels to the movement and to attract new people to join XR.

In March 2021, we are planning a national action that all rebels can do in their local cities and towns. This will be supported by a campaign of talks, trainings and meetings to grow the movement and our skills to bring people to XR. This includes delivering over 15 online Heading for Extinction talks by the end of March.

We need every rebel to get involved in outreach. Outreach is everyoneâ€™s role.  If everyone does a little outreach, together we can achieve a lot!

We are preparing this workshop to give you the inspiration, ideas and practical tips you need to get involved in outreach.

In this workshop we will explore:

Using the power of momentum driven organising 
Using the power of personal connections 
Using facebook for promotion and outreach
Online and email outreach 
How to organise ourselves to do outreach and promotion

description:
Register here: 
https://forms.organise.earth/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=369134&lang=en 

This online gathering aims to explore cultural difference, Western culture, colonisation, modern societies as well as Indigenous worldviews, perspectives and philosophies from around the world, including Australia, Africa, New Zealand and the Americas. 

Practical decolonial actions that flow from these perspectives will also be considered along with potential emergent decolonial futures. Formats will include presentations, interactive exercises in small breakout groups, and general questions and discussion.

This gathering will be hosted by XR Global Support Trainings and Regen 101 Working Group and will be facilitated by Dr. Yin Paradies, an Aboriginal-Asian-Anglo Australian of the Wakaya people from the Gulf of Carpentaria. He is a Professor of Race Relations at Deakin University, where he conducts research on racism and anti-racism as well as teaching and researching Indigenous knowledges and decoloniality. Yin is a climate and ecological activist who is committed to understanding and interrupting the devastating impacts of modern societies. 

He seeks meaningful mutuality of becoming and embodied kinship with all life through transformed ways of knowing, being, and doing that are grounded in wisdom, humility, respect, and generosity. He is a current Moora Moora resident, having moved to the mountain in 2020 to be in community, cultivate a closer connection to Country and engage in an ethos of down-shifted collective sufficiency, voluntary simplicity, frugality, direct democracy, and radical localisation.

While this is a "free" event we do invite participants to engage in the gift economy to support a local community climate change food growing group. 

Feel free to do so here:  PayPal.Me/YinParadies

Register here: 
https://forms.organise.earth/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=369134&lang=en

description:
Regen 101 - EVERYONE IS REGEN CREW! 

**This workshop is from 11AM to 2PM AEDT**

Register here: https://forms.organise.earth/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=939276&lang=en

This is a wonderful introduction to Regenerative Cultures for those new to XR and an essential experience for those who are already involved in the movement.

The online workshop has been adapted from an original 6-hour face-to-face workshop.

Together we will cover: What are Regenerative Cultures & Earth Emotions, Self-care & burnout alongside Emotional debriefing.

The Regen 101 Workshop was created in response to the need for XR Working Groups, and the wider community, to understand Regenerative Cultures is an essential strategy for Extinction Rebellion. 

As a workshop, it is experiential, practical, and educational and weaves through the topics so that the group leaves with an understanding of embodied Regenerative Activism.

HOMEWORK: The Regen 101 Booklet can be downloaded here: https://ausrebellion.earth/docs/Regen101.pdf 

It is intended as a supportive reference as well as a valuable, stand-alone resource for Regenerative Cultures.

It is useful to read the booklet before attending the workshop.

Register here: https://forms.organise.earth/index.php?r=survey/index&sid=939276&lang=en

Weâ€™re living in a time of global crisis, bearing witness to the effects of our governmentâ€™s inability to respond to the existential threats of the climate and ecological emergency, the COVID-19 pandemic and the ravages of a long history of systemic racism. Facing these threats alone can be overwhelming.  Join us to hear how Extinction Rebellion is bringing people together to act now and avoid total climate breakdown.  
This talk will lay out the basic climate science that drives our urgency to act and outline how we can use nonviolent direct action to demand change. Whether youâ€™re interested in joining Extinction Rebellion or just curious about whatâ€™s happening to the climate, come to hear more about what humanity is facing in the next decade, what has to happen to prevent catastrophe, and connect with others who are wrestling with these truths.

title: Heading for Extinction - And What to Do About It

description:
The Climate Crisis is upon us, yet not many understand it. Join this presentation to learn about what's transforming our planets climate and what the Extinction Rebellion movement has to offer in response.

Learn more about the state of the climate emergency and what we can do about it. In this event you will hear details regarding the state of our planet's quickly change climate, along with the impacts it has to the environment. Then, we will explore the alternative approach Extinction Rebellion offers compared to what has been tried for the last 50 years.

description:
George Monbiot, Bristol 

This event is delayed till 2021. All tickets are still valid for the new date. 

WE will email all paying ticket holders in January to confirm the new date. 

WE will also issue refunds if required through the eventbrite ticket page. 

George Monbiot comes to Bristol to discuss The Invisible Ideology Trashing Our Planet.

This three hour event will allow George and the audience to really delve deep into the damage that big business, media, advertising and mindless consumerism are having on our planet how we as individuals can help to solve these global issues.

15 short videos or the two hour full length video availble at the link below. 
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLTij8wOSJZNx2yTIo8Veeg4hkZF3nxTFQ

Tickets 
We are offering loads of low cost tickets for students so please share with friends as these event sell out fast! 

About George Monbiot: 
George is an author, Guardian columnist and environmental campaigner. His best-selling books include Feral: Rewilding the land, Sea and human life and Heat: how to stop the planet burning; his latest is Out of the Wreckage: a new politics for an age of crisis. He writes a weekly column for The Guardian, and is the author of a number of books, including Captive State: The Corporate Takeover of Britain (2000), Feral, Searching for the enchantment on the Frontiers of Rewilding (2013) and Out of the Wreckage: A New Politics in the Age of Crisis (2017).
In Bristol last year we filmed an amazing series of talks from George connecting the dots between climate emergency, mental health and consumerism. 

George Monbiotâ€™s website  - https://www.monbiot.com
Music 

 Tallulah Rendall has been blessing festivals and the Bristol music scene for many years with a mix of folk, rock and inspirational healing sounds for the mind and body.  Check out some of Tallulah's amazing music here - https://www.tallulahrendall.com

Details 
There is a bar and cafe on site serving food and drinks so you can meet friends early if you like. 

Door open at 6pm
Show starts at 7pm.

There will be no entry after 7pm so please arrive early. 

------------

Here are some videos from the last event we produced with George in Bristol. Please subscribe to LOVE IT TV and share this content far and wide!!!

V1 - George Monbiot - What does declaring a climate emergency actually mean?
https://youtu.be/2009H__4jGE

V2 -George Monbiot challenges the BBC to go further in naming and confronting power
https://youtu.be/Wh26c_7qPH0

V3 - George Monbiot - Celebrity is the mask the machine wears. 
https://youtu.be/3v5A9GWzcvQ

Non-Violent Direct Action training â€” get ready for the rebellion!

NEW SHORT TRAINING FORMAT

Are you planning to join the the upcoming actions with Extinction Rebellion Denmark? Or are you perhaps curious about what civil disobedience is? Then join us at our next Non-violent direct action (NVDA) training in Copenhagen.

Our trainings are open to everyone no matter your age, where you are from, where you live or how you define yourself, and it is not a requirement that you are already a part of Extinction Rebellion or that you are planning to be after. But we of course welcome you with open arms if you want to be.
It is free to participate.

The training is the perfect opportunity to learn about how NVDA is carried out in practice, and it will prepare you to participate in XRâ€™s actions or any other NVDA actions you find interesting. In XR we prefer that everyone who participate in our actions are well prepared and have participated in a training, so bring a friend or come alone, and letâ€™s prepare for the rebellion together.

Our will prepare you for doing NVDA, covering elements such as:

â€¢ an introduction to XR and NVDA
â€¢ decision-making during actions
â€¢ body and voice control
â€¢ deescalation
â€¢ interaction with the police
â€¢ potential legal consequences

Prepare from home, by seeing the playlist with intro videos which will be uploaded here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jKyJnIkf7aU...

It is important that everyone that participate watch the videos before the training, so we have the same information and can move on from that together.

If you have any questions, feel free to post them here and we will do our very best to answer them.


Love & Rage
Extinction Rebellion KBH

title: Deep Focus

description:
Dear rebels,

How do you stay true to yourself and interact with others in a positive way when you address the climate and ecological crisis? What can you do when someone gets angry about it or you get emotional yourself?

Extinction Rebellion (XR) is a nonviolent social movement addressing the climate and ecological crisis. For that, we need to develop new skills that help us to act and respond consciously, with skills that help us minimize harm. Nonviolent Communication (NVC) is a way of making contact that provides insights and choices regarding how we express whatâ€™s important to us while staying in connection with others.

Follow a free online Nonviolent Communication training to learn:
- How to find personal grounding and calm (via inner dialogue).
- How to differentiate between judgments & their underlying message.
- How to differentiate between behaviours & their underlying drivers/intentions.
- How to â€œdisarmâ€ and connect via empathic listening skills.
 
The introductory training which lasts 2 hours will be followed up a week later with practice sessions. These are for learning by doing - practising NVC by using the four steps for inner clarity and roleplaying, using participantsâ€™ real-life situations. The training is offered in English by Tamara (www.tamaracatharina.com).
 
Part 1
What: introduction to non-violent communication.
When: Tuesday 9 February 10:00-12:00
Where: Online via Zoom

Part 2
What: non-violent communication practice
When: Tuesday 16 February 10:00-12:00
Where: Online via Zoom

description:
XR North Meeting for all rebels!

There is so much to share with all our amazing rebels that we have decided to go to scheduling meetings for the whole of the North twice a month.

So next week we have a visit from Anneka and Diane to present to us the new 2021 UK actions strategy. This should be a presentation followed by a Q&A session for everyone to find out the thinking behind the new strategy and hopefully get some great ideas of how, even in the face of lock down, we can come together to push for the system change that it is increasingly so acutely obvious we need. 

Everyone is welcome, please share with your local groupsâ€¦

description:
Register FREE for Zoom details: 
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/ted-circle-how-to-meaningfully-reconnect-with-those-who-have-dementia-tickets-136185942821

By incorporating art and creativity into elder care settings, gerontologist Anne Basting helps families reconnect with loved ones who have dementia. In this moving talk, she shares how asking "beautiful questions" -- questions that don't have a right or wrong answer -- opens up a shared path of discovery, imagination and wonder. "If we can infuse creativity into care, caregivers can invite a partner into meaning-making," Basting says. "In that moment, care, which is so often associated with loss, can become generative."

We watch a TED video together then break into small groups for facilitated discussions, usually we get through four questions and groups reshuffled for each question.

description:
XRNI Regenerative Culture and Wellbeing are delighted to invite you to join this one-hour session with Louise Taylor and Alexey Janes on wellbeing in challenging times. 

Louise and Alexey will do a short presentation on wellbeing and self-care tools and techniques and then facilitate a group sharing on all things mindful, meaningful, and peaceful. 

Louise is a currently a PhD student at Queenâ€™s University Belfast studying the relationship between Nature and Mental Health. She is also a qualified counsellor and coach with a particular interest in ecotherapy and ecopsychology. 

Alexeyâ€™s current work involves the delivery of wild wellness and wellbeing sessions. He has worked on a wide range of community-based projects in Scotland and Northern Ireland, focussed on the connection between people and the natural environment.

description:
Join Extinction Rebellion Vermont this winter as we read "All We Can Save: Truth, Courage, and Solutions for the Climate Crisis," edited by Ayana Elizabeth Johnson & Katharine K. Wilkinson. A collection of "provocative and illuminating essays from women at the forefront of the climate movement who are harnessing truth, courage, and solutions to lead humanity forward."

Register here: https://forms.gle/dv2vLn1jQ7cSPcHW8

Details:

Wednesdays, 6:30 - 7:30pm, February 3, 10, 17, 24, March 3, 10, 17, 24, 31, April  7

Meet weekly via Zoom for 60 minutes over 10 weeks, reading a section of the book prior to each meeting (~40 pages/week).

**Space is limited to provide space for rich dialogue. If there is enough interest, we may offer an additional meeting time (likely a weekend morning).

Register here: https://forms.gle/dv2vLn1jQ7cSPcHW8

More about the book: "There is a renaissance blooming in the climate movement: leadership that is more characteristically feminine and more faithfully feminist, rooted in compassion, connection, creativity, and collaboration. While itâ€™s clear that women and girls are vital voices and agents of change for this planet, they are too often missing from the proverbial â€œtable.â€ More than a problem of bias, itâ€™s a dynamic that sets us up for failure. To change everything, we need everyone. Intermixing essays with poetry and art, this book is both a balm and a guide for knowing and holding what has been done to the world, while bolstering our resolve never to give up on each other or our collective future. We must summon truth, courage, and solutions, to turn away from the brink and toward life-giving possibility. Curated by two climate leaders, this book is a collection and celebration of visionaries who are leading us on a path toward all we can save." (Source: allwecansave.earth)

description:
**Note change in location**

This action will disrupt the pillars of power that profit based on the exploitation of the planet. 

Join Extinction Rebellion for a day of community building and stepping into our roles as citizens. We are in open rebellion against a government that is guilty of breaking the social contract through its criminal inaction to reverse the climate and ecological crisis faced by all life on Earth. 

The action will include a meet-up at Callister Park, where we will announce next steps in our spring plan for civil resistance. We will participate in a march and direct action thereafter. The action will include regenerative practices and a clothing swap for anyone who wishes to participate. 

The Trans Mountain Expansion Project will increase tanker traffic in the inlet and around the port of Vancouver by at least 7 fold.  It will also increase Canadaâ€™s carbon emissions making it impossible for Canada to meet its criminally inadequate climate targets. The pipeline is being forced through Indigenous lands without consent from the host nations, and also substantially increases the chances of oil spills. All this as we know that according to scientists, an increase of over 2 degrees global average temperatures is now locked in.

We demand that the government tell the truth to the ordinary Canadians about the grim consequences of the climate emergency, and its inaction in the face of it. Due to this failure, citizens are now under a moral obligation to participate in mass civil disobedience to force the implementation of institutional democratic upgrades including a Citizens Assembly on Climate and Ecological Justice. Our very lives may depend on it.

This event takes place on the unceded lands of the Coast Salish peoples.

description:
REBELLION OF ONE | Cambridge Briefing | Wednesday Jan 20th, 7:30pm-9pm

â€œIf putting my body in the road is what it takes to call attention to this, then I am terrified enough to do it.â€

Rebellion Of One is a single-person roadblock, times 1,000. At midday on 27th March (and subsequent days and times, to be agreed) individuals across the UK (seemingly spontaneously) sit down in the road, alone, in front of traffic. They wear a sandwich board with a simple and emotive message. They remain sitting in the road until they choose to move, or are moved.

Wait, what? Single person roadblock? That sounds dangerous. Yes, it is. Each protester will be accompanied by a secret support team, hiding in plain sight amongst the passersby on the pavement.

This briefing will go over the strategy, objectives and preparation pathway of Rebellion of One. There will be opportunity to ask questions.

description:
What is it? A one hour interactive online workshop for you and your family about the climate and ecosystems. We will learn about some of the science behind the climate crisis and what you can do about it. There will be time to ask your questions, as well as some opportunity for creativity and competition! No prior knowledge is required - just an open mind and curiosity to learn more. There will be parts of the workshop where parents/carers and children will need to work together, and you will probably want a pen and paper too.

Who is it for? The workshop is aimed at parents/carers and children aged 7-14, but other ages are also welcome. Please make sure that children are accompanied at all times during the workshop.

When and where? The workshop is on zoom on Tuesday 19th December from 6-7pm on Zoom. It's the first time we've run this so please bear with us as we try out our brand new workshop script and iron out any issues. Please use this zoom link to join us02web.zoom.us/j/81418282448 or use the zoom ID 814 1828 2448

Who is running it? We are a group of people who work in education in the Cambridgeshire area and know each other through Extinction Rebellion.

Any questions? Contact us at xr_cam_teachers_for_truth@protonmail.com.

The workshop will be run by teachers and educators. At least one workshop host will be a teacher with a DBS check. Please ensure that children are supervised at all times.

description:
(english below)
Wanneer we denken aan rouw vergeten we vaak dat in de emoties die verlies en afscheid vergezellen vaak de sleutel naar onze verbinding met het leven zelf ligt. Zowel op persoonlijk als collectief niveau.Een blessing in disguise.
Dankbaar voor de handvatten die Joanna Macy, Stephen Jenkinson, Linda Wormhoudt en vele andere leraren aanreiken, die ons helpen om rouw te herkennen en een plek in ons leven te geven, nodigen wij je uit om deel te nemen.
De heldere en toegankelijke methoden creÃ«ren een veilige ruimte, die nodig is om de diepe emoties die wij tegen komen een plaats tegeven, nu wij ons beginnen te realiseren dat de wereldwijde crisis waarin wij ons bevinden niet meer te voorkomen is, en de verschillende crises niet meer los van ekaar te zien zijn: we zitten er midden in!
Door ruimte te maken voor onze rauwe rouw komen we de andere kant van dezelfde medaille tegen: onze liefde voor het leven! Een verbinding die we nodig hebben om vol te houden, om steeds weer op te staan.
Wanneer je deel wilt nemen, stuur dan een e-mail naar irene@de-grenswaker.nl ; dan ontvang je de toegang-link.
VERGEET NIET OM DE LINK OP TE VRAGEN
********************************************
When we think of grief, we often forget that the key to our connection with life itself lies in the emotions that accompany loss and farewell. A blessing in disguise.
Grateful for the tools that Joanna Macy, Stephen Jenkinson, Linda Wormhoudt and many other teachers, which help us to give mourning a place in our lives again, we invite you to participate.
The clear and accessible methods create a safe space, which is necessary to hold space for the emotions we encounter, as we begin to realize that the global crisis in which we find ourselves can no longer be prevented, and the crises we face can no longer be seen as separate from each other: we are in the midst of a global collaps!
By making room for our grief, we encounter the other side of the same coin: our love for life! A connection we need to sustain, to be able to stand up again and again.
If you want to participate, send a personal message to irene@de-grenswaker.nl ; you will receive the access link.
DON'T FORGET TO REQUEST THE LINK

Hey Earth, you're looking pretty hot today! No actually, we're very concerned...

Show your love for life on this planet by joining Extinction Rebellion this Valentine's Day at Pikes Place! We will be disrupting business as usual demanding climate action in the face of an unprecedented global ecological crisis. We will be at the entrance to Pike Place singing climate-themed love songs while writing love letters to the planet and to those lost in the sixth mass extinction. This will be a non-violent action, masks will be required and social distancing will be practiced.

title: Accueil des nouveaux et des nouvelles

description:
Non-violent direct action or peaceful civil disobedience has a long history of success in achieving large change, from the Indian Independence Movement to the Civil Rights Movement.

At this NVDA workshop, you'll become empowered with these skills, so you can join Extinction Rebellion in taking climate action now.

The training covers the principles of non-violent direct action, why it works, the definition of non-violence, a legal rights briefing, and role-plays to get you ready for common peaceful civil disobedience scenarios

title: Pedal for our Planet - Oceans are Rising

description:
XRWA's Contemplative Rebels invite you to join us in silence and stillness to bear witness to the climate and ecological emergency. We will hold an hour-long period of contemplative sitting at Yagan Square. You are welcome to join us to meditate, pray, reflect or just be.

We will gather in solidarity with the Earth and all beings impacted by the climate crisis. 

A few of us will also do Outreach and chat to the public about XR.

Bring along a cushion, stool or chair to sit on. You may also wish to bring a blanket or mat for your knees. Please bring along a spare cushion or chair if you are able to, to offer to others who might want to join us. Feel free to join us for all or part of the action.

We will hold two rounds of sitting meditation, separated by a short walking meditation. 

Also feel free to bring an offering of some kind to sit with: A placard, an artwork, some flowers, a rock, or any other object you feel is appropriate.

Meet at the centre of Yagan Square at 3.45 pm. We will sit together between 4 pm and 5 pm.

We acknowledge that we sit on the land of the Whadjuk Nyungar people. We pay respect to the Traditional Custodians and to Elders past, present and future. Sovereignty was never ceded.

title: RÃ©union d'accueil

description:
Maak jij je ook zorgen om de klimaat- en ecologische crisis? Ben je klaar met toekijken hoe politici en bedrijven ons naar de afgrond leiden? 

Zoals je weet pakken we het bij Extinction Rebellion anders aan. We gaan voorbij aan klimaatmarsen en petities, en bouwen een massabeweging die het tij kan keren. En in deze bijeenkomst leer je hoe je op een manier die bij jou past mee kan rebelleren!

De bijeenkomst is online via zoom, tegelijkertijd in zowel Nederlands als Engels. De link voor de Nederlandse sessie: https://xrb.link/B519Ox4

DEEL 1: Het eerste uur hebben we het over de klimaat- en ecologische crisis, met uiteraard ruimte voor interactie. Het is erger dan je denkt, maar geen zorgen: je hoort ook over Extinction Rebellion, en hoe wij denken het verschil te kunnen maken.

DEEL 2: Bouw mee aan XR! In deze sessie leer je hoe jij je met een paar uurtjes per week in kan zetten op een manier die bij je past. Als manusje van alles bij je lokale groep, of juist als specialist bij een nationale kring: van juridische of mentale ondersteuning tot het organiseren of promoten van acties en evenementen, en nog vÃ©Ã©l meer.

Ben je alleen nieuwsgierig naar XR? Dan kan je ook naar alleen het eerste deel komen. Ken je deel 1 al? Dan ben je van harte welkom om slechts voor het tweede gedeelte om 15.00 uur aan te sluiten!

Tot dan! En, kan je nou niet wachten om in actie te komen? Nodig dan je vrienden of familie uit om samen mee te doen, en help zo de beweging alvast te groeien!

_______

Are you also worried about the climate and ecological crisis? Are you done standing idly by as politicians and businesses lead us to a 4-degree world?

As you're aware, Extinction Rebellion has a special approach. Going beyond climate marches and petitions, we are building a mass movement that can turn the tide. In this meeting youï¿½ll learn all about how to rebel in a way that suits you!

The meeting is online via Zoom, simultaneously in both Dutch and English. The link for the English session: https://xrb.link/d7TG97

PART 1: We'll start the first hour taking a deep dive into the climate and ecological crisis, with room for interaction of course. It's worse than you think, but don't worry: you'll also hear about Extinction Rebellion, and how we think we can turn this ship around.

PART 2: Start organising! This session is all about how you can contribute a few hours, in a week in a way that suits you. As an all-rounder in your local group, or as a specialist with a national circle: from legal or mental support to organizing or promoting actions and events - and much, much more.

Are you curious about XR, but don't want to help organise? Then you're more than welcome to only join the first part. Do you already know part 1? Then by all means join for the second part at 3 pm!

See you there! Can't wait to start contributing? Then invite your friends or family to join you to this meeting, and help the movement grow already!

description:
A chance to get involved with 2 practical actions.  

We have 2 speakers Jed and Andy who will give brief introductions into what they are doing in Leeds to tackle poverty and needless consumption at the same time. We will then break into smaller groups to discuss how we can support these ideas. 

 

The 'Library of Things' is an exciting idea spreading across the UK.

The plan is to make borrowing better than buying.

This is:

More affordable and convenient

"90% of borrowers say they now have more money to spend on things important to them."

Socially rewarding

"75% of borrowers feel better connected to their community because of Library of Things."

Kinder to the planet

"Having used Library of Things, borrowers are 60% more likely to repair or recycle items."

Read more about it here: https://www.libraryofthings.co.uk/why

Jed is starting a Library of things in Leeds - come and find out how you can join in!

This idea can spread across the city.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Reducing carbon emissions from our homes is crucial to reach Net Zero Carbon.

Unless we massively reduce emissions from houses - indeed all buildings - we'll never reach Net Zero Carbon.

There are many other benefits too - including lots of green jobs and improved health for millions of people.

The Leeds Citizens' Jury made a strong recommendation to empower local community groups to insulate Leeds houses.

https://www.leedsclimate.org.uk/sites/default/files/CJ%20recommendations%20FINAL%20.pdf

Leeds City Council has done nothing to make this happen.

Andy Walker (aka Andy Van Traveller) is engaging communities to work together and encouraging individuals to fix their own homes.

This includes Insulation, Air-tightness improvement and the use of Air Source Heat Pumps.

Strong campaigning is needed as well as grass-roots action to raise the public awareness of what can be achieved - and then drive the politicians to make the funds available - both for training and for a huge installation programme.

Read more about it here: https://www.SUREinsulation.co.uk

Come and hear how to make your home warmer - and reduce your fuel bills and carbon emissions at the same time!

Both will be via this link 06:15 PM - 7:45PM
Join Zoom Meeting
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/462114343
Meeting ID: 462 114 343

Weâ€™re living in a time of global crisis. We bear witness to the effects of our governmentâ€™s inability to respond to the existential threats of the climate and ecological emergency, the COVID-19 pandemic and the ravages of a long history of systemic racism. This talk will lay out the basic climate science that drives our urgency to act and outline how we can use nonviolent direct action to demand change.
